localizedDescriptions.en: Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.
Identification information about the report.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.

annotations.comment: Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.

annotations.comment:
Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.

localizedDescriptions.en: Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.

annotations.comment: Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.

localizedDescriptions.en: Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.

annotations.comment: Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.

localizedDescriptions.en: Local cluster to capture specific details (not available elsewhere) for cancer diagnosis in Genomics England Cancer datasets.
An indication of whether a diagnosis of recurrence has been recorded for which a new Cancer Care Plan is required.
The morphology code for the diagnosed cancer as defined by ICDO3 or SNOMED CT or SNOMED RT. Terminology mappings should be used.

annotations.comment: The SNOMED version should be captured as part of the code string.

localizedDescriptions.en: The topography code for the diagnosed cancer as defined by ICDO3 or SNOMED CT or SNOMED RT. Terminology mappings should be used.

annotations.comment: The SNOMED version should be captured as part of the code string.

localizedDescriptions.en: Tumour laterality identifies the side of the body for a tumour relating to paired organs within a PATIENT based on the evidence from a pathological examination.
Details of specific upper GI cancer staging in the context of GEL cancer datasets.
Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer stage.
Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer stage.
Very early stage.
Early stage.
Intermediate stage.
Advanced stage.
Terminal stage.
Details of clinical stage for pancreatic cancer.
FIGO grade for ovarian and endometrial cancer.
Details of FIGO grade.

Predominant glandular growth and < 5% nonsquamous solid component; glandular architecture is identified by the presence of patent lumina within the gland, relatively preserved polarity of the epithelium and absent to mild epithelial stratification.
6-50 percent nonsquamous solid component.
More than 50 percent nonsquamous solid component.
Version of FIGO classification used.
Specific diagnosis details for colorectal cancer in the context of GEL cancer datasets.
Details of synchronous tumour indicator.
Modified Dukes staging for colorectal cancer.
Details of colorectal cancer stage according to Dukes.
Dukes A Tumour confined to wall of bowel, nodes negative.
Dukes B Tumour penetrates through the muscularis propria to involve extramural tissues, nodes negative.
Dukes C1 Metastases confined to regional lymph nodes (node/s positive but apical node negative).
Dukes C2 Metastases present in nodes at mesenteric artery ligature (apical node positive).
Dukes D Metastatic spread outside the operative field.
Dukes stage is not known.
Specific staging details for testicular cancer in the context of GEL cancer datasets.
Details of extranodal metastases.
Details of lung metastases sub-stage grouping.
A framework for the clinical classification and stage grouping of malignancies using the TNM system.

annotations.comment: Designated as TNM or cTNM.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the the extent of the primary tumour.

annotations.comment: Coding with a T code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'T1'; or 'cT3'. Represented as 'T' or 'cT' in the 'TNM assessment'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the the absence or presence and extent of regional lymph node metastasis.

annotations.comment: Coding with an N code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'NX'; or 'cN2'. Represented as 'N' or 'cN' within the 'TNM assessment'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the absence or presence of distant metastasis.

annotations.comment: Coding with an M code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'M1'; 'cM1a'; 'M1 PUL'; or 'cM0'. Represented as 'M' or 'cM' within the 'TNM assessment'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Histopathological grading of the tumour.

annotations.comment: Pretreatment histopathological assessment may be determined from a limited biopsy prior to formal resection. Coding with a G code appropriate for the identified tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'G2'; 'GX'; or 'low grade' for bone and soft tissue sarcoma classification. Represented as 'G' within the 'TNM assessment'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The categorisation of the anatomical stage of the tumour, usually based on TNM assessment.

annotations.comment: For example: carcinoma in situ is categorised as stage 0; or tumours with distant metastasis are categorised as stage IV.

localizedDescriptions.en: The edition of the TNM classification system used for the assessment.
Local cluster for the capture of the tumour Id in the Genomics England Cancer dataset.
The identifier for the tumour.
SCR metastases
cancer wait times
Child-Pugh score used for chronic liver disease/cirrhosis prognosis.
Total Child-Pugh score.
An screeing questionnaire for conditions, including problems and diagnoses.
Grouping of data elements related to screening for a single condition.
Name of the condition being screened.
Presence of the condition.
The specific condition is present.
The specific condition is not present.
Additional narrative about the conditions, not captured in other fields.
Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
SCR Palliative care assessment
Holistic Needs Assessment Summary

annotations.comment: Use for managing a summary of the McMillan Holistic Needs Assessment process.

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.
Identification of the procedure by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.

annotations.comment: Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.

annotations.comment: This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.

localizedDescriptions.en: A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.
Identification of the procedure by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the body site for the procedure.

annotations.comment: Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.

localizedDescriptions.en: Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.

annotations.comment: For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.

annotations.comment: This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.

localizedDescriptions.en: A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.
Identification of the procedure by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.

annotations.comment: Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.

localizedDescriptions.en: Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.

annotations.comment: For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.

annotations.comment: This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.
Identification of the procedure by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.

annotations.comment: This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.

localizedDescriptions.en: A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.
Identification of the procedure by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.

annotations.comment: This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Record the findings and interpretation of an imaging examination performed.
The name of the imaging examination or procedure performed.

annotations.comment: Coding with a terminology, potentially a pre-coordinated term specifying both modality and anatomical location, is desirable where possible. Possible candidate terminologies: LOINC, SNOMED CT or RadLex.

localizedDescriptions.en: Type of equipment that originally acquired the image or series of images.

annotations.comment: Also known as 'Examination type'. For example: Ultrasound; Computed tomography; or X-ray. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible. If the modality is specified by a code in the Examination result name, then this field may be redundant.

localizedDescriptions.en: Simple description about the physical place on, or in, the body that was imaged.

annotations.comment: This data element is redundant if the anatomical site is identified in the 'Test name'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative concise, clinically relevant interpretation of all imaging findings, and include a comparison with previous studies where appropriate.

annotations.comment: Also referred to as 'Opinion' or 'Impression'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description about the technical details and procedure.

annotations.comment: For example: outline of technique; non-routine alternative or additional imaging; nature and route of administration of contrast agent, radiopharmaceuticals and/or treatments administered; adverse reactions to contrast media.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details concerning a single examination requested. Note: Usually there is one examination request for each result, however in some circumstances multiple examination requests may be represented using a single Imaging examination result archetype.
The local identifier given to the imaging examination report.
The result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.
Name of the laboratory investigation performed on the specimen(s).

annotations.comment: A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. It is strongly recommended that 'Test name' be coded with a terminology, for example LOINC or SNOMED CT. For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'.

localizedDescriptions.en: To record details of a GEL histopathology summary.
The number of local and regional nodes reported as being positive for the presence of Tumour metastases (in this specimen report only).
Number of nodes examined, where applicable.
Details of excision margins.
A framework for the pathological classification and stage grouping of malignancies using the TNM system.

annotations.comment: Designated as pTNM.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the extent of the primary tumour.

annotations.comment: Coding with a T code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'pT1'; or 'pT3'. Represented as 'pT' in the 'TNM assessment'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the absence or presence and extent of regional lymph node metastasis.

annotations.comment: Coding with an N code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'pNX'; or 'pN2'. Represented as 'pN' in the 'TNM assessment'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the absence or presence of distant metastasis.

annotations.comment: Coding with an M code appropriate for the tumour type and anatomical site is expected. For example: 'pM1'. Represented as 'pM' in the 'TNM assessment'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description of the key findings.

annotations.comment: For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed. This conclusion should be aligned with the coded 'Test diagnosis'.

localizedDescriptions.en: A local identifier assigned by the receiving Laboratory Information System (LIS) to track the test process.

annotations.comment: This identifier is an internal tracking number assigned by the LIS, and it not intended to be the name of the test.

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.

annotations.comment: Height is measured with the individual in a standing position and body length in a recumbent position.

localizedDescriptions.en: The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.
Measurement of the body weight of an individual.
The weight of the individual.
Summary or persistent information about the tobacco smoking habits of an individual.
Statement about current smoking behaviour for all types of tobacco.
Individual has never smoked any type of tobacco.
Individual is a current smoker of tobacco.
Individual has previously smoked tobacco but is not a current smoker.
Alcohol consumption according to UK COSD standards
COSD codes for alcohol status

annotations.comment:
Heavy (>14 Units per week)	1
Light (<=14 Units per week)	2
Never	3
Not Known	9
Not Stated (person asked but declined to provide a response)	Z

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Summary or persistent information about an individual's menstruation history.
Age at onset of first menstrual cycle.
Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.

localizedDescriptions.en: The time period during which the predicted health risk is relevant.

annotations.comment: That is: the risk of experiencing the identified 'Health risk' in the next <X> years.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.

localizedDescriptions.en: The time period during which the predicted health risk is relevant.

annotations.comment: That is: the risk of experiencing the identified 'Health risk' in the next <X> years.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.

localizedDescriptions.en: Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.

localizedDescriptions.en: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Local archetype to capture death details in Genomics England cancer and rare diseases datasets.
The date of death of the patient.
The location where death occurred.
The participant died in hospital.

list.label: 2: NHS hospice or specialist palliative care unit

localizedLabels.en: 2: NHS hospice or specialist palliative care unit

localizedDescriptions.en: The participant died in an NHS hospice or NHS specialist palliative care unit.

list.label: 3: Voluntary hospice or specialist palliative care unit

localizedLabels.en: 3: Voluntary hospice or specialist palliative care unit

localizedDescriptions.en: The participant died in a voluntary hospice or voluntary specialist palliative care unit.
The participant died in their own home.
The participant died in a care home.
The participant died in a location not specified by the other options.
Immediate cause of death. Coded according to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD) code of the condition leading to death as recorded on the death certificate.
Research participation
Care team details aligned with FHIR resource. This is an ADMIN ENTRY wrapper archetype to contain the Care team CLUSTER archetype where it has no natural ENTRY level parent.
Care team details aligned with FHIR resource.
A label for human use intended to distinguish like teams.

annotations.comment: E.g. the "red" vs. "green" trauma teams.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.
Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.
Contacts for patients and organisations (excluding practitioners).
Name details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.
A text representation of the full name.
Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.
Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.
Contacts for patients and organisations (excluding practitioners).

Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.

Anonymised details of a person.
Ther current administrative gender of the person.
The sex / gender is male.
The sex / gnder is female.
The sex/ gender is indeterminate.
The sex/ gender is unknown.
The sex of the person at birth.
The sex / gender is male.
The sex / gnder is female.
The sex/ gender is indeterminate.
The sex/ gender is unknown.
Whether the patient is alive or dead.
The patient is alive.
The patient has died.
The age of the person. This may be calculated.
The patient's current location anonymised.

Name associated with the organisation.
Address details aligned with FHIR resource.
This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.
This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.
This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.
A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.
Comments made about the participant.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Request for a health-related service or activity to be delivered by a clinician, organisation or agency.
Current Activity.
The name of the single service or activity requested.

annotations.comment: Coding of the 'Service name' with a coding system is desirable, if available. For example: 'referral' to an endocrinologist for diabetes management.

localizedDescriptions.en: A short phrase describing the reason for the request.

annotations.comment: Coding of the 'Reason for request' with a coding system is desirable, if available. This data element allows multiple occurrences to enable the user to record a multiple responses, if required. For example: 'manage diabetes complications'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Practitioner details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identifier details aligned with FHIR resources or data types.
The identifier value.
Name details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.
A text representation of the full name.
FHIR telecom details.
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The communication form is phone.
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
FHIR telecom details.
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The communication form is email.
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).

Name associated with the organisation.

A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.
Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.
Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
A scale used by clinicians to assess the functional performance status of a patient with a diagnosis of cancer. Also known as the WHO performance status or Zubrod performance status.
The functional performance status of a patient with a diagnosis of cancer.
Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

list.label: Symptomatic, in bed <50% of the day

localizedLabels.en: Symptomatic, in bed <50% of the day

localizedDescriptions.en: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

list.label: Symptomatic, in bed >50% of the day (but not bedridden)

localizedLabels.en: Symptomatic, in bed >50% of the day (but not bedridden)

localizedDescriptions.en: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair.
Patient has died.
Additional narrative about the overall ECOG performance status not captured in other fields.
Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
